solution.text:
1 dm = 10cm
Area of Base \(= \pi r^2 = \pi (_{j}_)^2 = _{{pi_val*(j**2)}}_ dm^2 = _{{100*pi_val*(j**2)}}_ cm^2\)
Rise of water level = h = _{k}_ cm
Therefore, volume of rain water harvested \(= _{{100*pi_val*(j**2)}}_ \times _{k}_ = _{{100*pi_val*k*(j**2)}}_ cm^3\)
1 L \(= 1000cm^3\)
Volume of rain water harvested \(= _{{pi_val*k*(j**2)*Decimal('0.1')}}_ L\)

content.text: You have set up a rain-water harvesting system at your home. A cylindrical container with a radius of _{j}_ dm collects rain-water from your roof. It rained last Monday and some water was collected, raising the height of water in the container by _{k}_ cm. What volume of rain water was collected (in litres)?
